post.summary: Generates a JSON Web Token to be used for gaining alternative access to eShare.

requestBody.description: A container for the user ID that the token is generated for.

get.summary: Authenticates to eShare and responds with an authorization token.
get.description:
Please note that authentication should only be done over secure HTTPS connection.
            
If successful, the server responds with status code 204, with X-CAD-Authorization header in the response.
This session header is used to gain access to eShare, and should be used in all other requests.
            
If the authentication fails, the server returns status code 401.

parameters.name: authorization
parameters.description: The query parameter used by the endpoint to authenticate. Supports Basic authentication format. Not needed if authentication is passed in the Authorization header.

get.summary: Gets information about all indexed documents, such as their metadata and link values. Additionally, the endpoint can tell if the link leads to a model object in the model or not.

parameters.name: projectId
parameters.description: The ID of the project.

parameters.name: isReferenceIncluded
parameters.description: If true, does an additional search for all the links to find whether the link references an object in the model or not.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The offset value of the documents to be fetched from the server.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of documents to be fetched from the server.

post.summary: Creates a new document to the project.

parameters.name: projectId
parameters.description: The ID of the project.

get.summary: Gets information of all of the documents available to the user.

parameters.name: projectId
parameters.description: The ID of the project.

put.summary: Updates a document with a new version.

parameters.name: projectId
parameters.description: The ID of the project.

parameters.name: projectId
parameters.description: The ID of the project.

parameters.name: projectId
parameters.description: The ID of the project.

parameters.name: projectId
parameters.description: The ID of the project.

parameters.name: documentId

parameters.name: documentId

parameters.name: projectId

get.summary: List all markups in this project (that are visible to this user).
Get details of a markup by its ID.

Gets a markup thumbnail by its attribute ID. To get a thumbnail URL for a markup, call
a markup endpoint and use the ThumbnailUrl property.
Get all model attribute definitions for the given project.
Returns model hierarchies information of the project.

parameters.name: projectId
parameters.description: Project ID (GUID)

get.summary: Returns a list of available model hierarchies in the project.

parameters.name: projectId
parameters.description: Project ID (GUID)

get.summary: Gets the attributes associated with the specified model item, such as an object.

parameters.name: objectId
parameters.description: The id (GUID) of the item.

parameters.name: attributes
parameters.description: The list of wanted model object attribute abbreviations. If omitted, all available attributes are included.

parameters.name: includeKeys
parameters.description: Whether to include key attributes in the response regardless of the value of attributes parameter. Has no effect if attributes parameter is omitted.

parameters.name: scope
parameters.description:
Defines what attributes are wanted.
<list type="table">
  <item>"Model" gets the attributes defined in the model, as well as points of interests linked to the item.</item>
  <item>"Statuses" gets the status trackings and their values.</item>
  <item>"Documents" gets the documents linked to the item.</item>
  <item>"DataSources" gets the attributes of all the external object attribute data sources linked to the item.</item>
  <item>"All" gets all the attributes related to the item.</item>
</list>
            By default, "Model" is used as the scope.

post.summary: Returns basic information of all the items of the given item in the given model hierarchy
post.description: Note: Does not support new dynamic model hierarchies.

parameters.name: hierarchyName
parameters.description: The name of the model hierarchy. Case sensitive.

parameters.name: targetObject
parameters.description: Target item in the hierarchy which children should be fetched. Optional. If not given, the root level of the hierarchy is fetched instead.

post.summary: Gets the attributes of multiple model items.

parameters.name: scope
parameters.description:
Defines what attributes are wanted.
<list type="table">
  <item>"Model" gets the attributes defined in the model, as well as points of interests linked to the item.</item>
  <item>"Statuses" gets the status trackings and their values.</item>
  <item>"Documents" gets the documents linked to the item.</item>
  <item>"DataSources" gets the attributes of all the external object attribute data sources linked to the item.</item>
  <item>"All" gets all the attributes related to the item.</item>
</list>
            By default, "Model" is used as the scope.

parameters.name: attributes
parameters.description: The list of wanted model object attribute abbreviations. If omitted, all available attributes are included.

parameters.name: includeKeys
parameters.description: Whether to include key attributes in the response regardless of the value of attributes parameter. Has no effect if attributes parameter is omitted.

requestBody.description: The list of wanted item ids.

get.summary: Provides information about the eShare server, such as which login method the server is using.
Gets information about each status tracking kind allowed for the user, as well as of all the available states they have

post.summary: Updates status tracking states with the given status tracking entries.
